instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2838 Green light, now fan or power.
threads.message:
I'm having a bad run with MBAs this week... :/
2879-B I can fix in under 15 minutes 95% of the time, but these things I always struggle with.



[COLOR=#333333][FONT=Verdana]I'm getting PP3v3_S5 but no PP3v3_S3.[/FONT][/COLOR]

[COLOR=#333333][FONT=Verdana]S5 creates S3, I believe (can someone confirm?), so I need to find that chip in the schematic and see what it's pushing out.[/FONT][/COLOR]


[COLOR=#333333][FONT=Verdana]The board shocks me periodically too. Is this a sign something is shorting to ground?


Does Q7910 create S3 power rail?[/FONT][/COLOR]

[COLOR=#333333][FONT=Verdana]Q7910:1 = ~88mV (PP3V3_S3)[/FONT][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#333333][FONT=Verdana]Q7910:2 = 8mV     (PP3V3_S3)[/FONT][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#333333][FONT=Verdana]Q7910:3 = 3.3v     (P3V3S3_SS)[/FONT][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#333333][FONT=Verdana]Q7910:4 = 3.3v     (PP3V3_S5[/FONT][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#333333][FONT=Verdana]Q7910:5 = 0v        (PP3V3_S3)[/FONT][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#333333][FONT=Verdana]Q7910:6 = 20mV   (PP3V3_S3)[/FONT][/COLOR]

[COLOR=#333333][FONT=Verdana]The way I read the schematic (page 59), is that Q7910 takes PP3v3_S5 and creates PP3v3_S3 from it, however it is not putting out PP3V3_S3 thus it is faulty.[/FONT][/COLOR]

[COLOR=#333333][FONT=Verdana]Sound right?[/FONT][/COLOR]

threads.title: 820-2838 Green light, now fan or power.
threads.message: These do not power on by themselves. Does PM_PWRBTN_L toggle when you try to power it on? If that seems ok what is the voltage on both pins of Y2810?

threads.title: 820-2838 Green light, now fan or power.
threads.message:
I didn't know that.
Will check when I'm back at the office in 12 hours.

threads.title: 820-2838 Green light, now fan or power.
threads.message:
Laptop boots on the bench, but not in the case...

Really weird...

threads.title: 820-2838 Green light, now fan or power.
threads.message: Really easy, bad power button on keyboard or bad flat cable/connector/trackpad.

threads.title: 820-2838 Green light, now fan or power.
threads.message:
I don't think so.
There are no cables plugged in and I am starting it by shorting the pads.

threads.title: 820-2838 Green light, now fan or power.
threads.message: Well, what is connected in the case and not on the bench? Different IO board?
